articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-party Talks
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Six-party Talks 
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK delegation led by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left here today to attend the six-party talks to be held in Beijing from Feb. 8.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and other officials, Guan Huabing, minister-councillor of the Chinese embassy here, and Vladimir Arkhipenko, councillor of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: Mongolian Organization Decides to Award Order to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Mongolian Organization Decides to Award Order to Kim Il Sung 
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The Guidance Council of the Federation of Peace and Friendship Organizations of Mongolia decided on Jan. 18 to award "Gold Star of Peace," the highest order of the council, to President Kim Il Sung, on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, reflecting the profound veneration of the Mongolian people for him.

articles.title: Multifarious Events Held
142nd Friday Meeting Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
142nd Friday Meeting Held in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Civic and social organizations including the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration reportedly held the 142nd Friday meeting in front of the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Feb. 2 in protest against the U.S. and war and for the withdrawal of the U.S. troops from south Korea.
 Speakers at the meeting deplored the fact that culture is being degenerated in south Korea due to the U.S. troops present in south Korea.    
 Participants in a resolution adopted at the meeting held that there is no ground for the U.S. to keep its forces and military bases in south Korea any longer as those bases are a source of corrupt culture and a cesspool of crime.

articles.title: Poster for 11th Kimjongilia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster for 11th Kimjongilia Festival Produced 
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- A poster has been produced for the 11th Kimjongilia Festival to be held on the occasion of the February holiday.
 Depicted on the center of the poster are Kimjongilias in full bloom against the background of the sun.    
 On its upper part is the mark of the festival and on its lower part the letters reading "Celebration of February 16" and "The 11th Kimjongilia Festival."

Credentials of Russian Ambassador Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of Russian Ambassador Accepted
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Valery E. Sukhinin at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kung Sok Ung and staff members of the Russian embassy.    
 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Palestine
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Mahmoud Abbas, chief of the Palestinian National Authority, on the occasion of his birthday.
 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned by Mohammad Shahta Zarab, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, on Thursday.

Secretary General of "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council Arrives
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Vishwanath, secretary general of the "International Kim Il Sung Prize" Council, arrived here Thursday to celebrate the birthday of Kim Jong Il.

Foreign Diplomats Visit Int'l Friendship Exhibition
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Int'l Friendship Exhibition
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the International Friendship Exhibition Thursday on the threshold of the auspicious February holiday.
 The members of the corps went round with deep emotion the gifts to Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il by party and state leaders, eminent figures of political and public circles, people of different strata in various countries and south Korean people representing their profound respect and best wishes.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of African Union
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of African Union
   Pyongyang, February 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Feb.7 sent a congratulatory message to Ghanaian President John Agyekum Kufuor on the latter's election as President of the African Union at the 8th Ordinary Session of the Assembly of the Heads of State and Government of the African Union. 
 The message said that his assumption of heavy responsibility as the president of the union is an expression of its member countries' trust and expectation for him and the Republic of Ghana that have made a positive contribution to peace and progress on the African continent and in the sub-region of Western Africa.    
 Expressing the belief that the AU would achieve signal progress in its efforts to attain the integration and prosperity of the continent and solidarity and cooperation among its member countries, the message wished the President of Ghana success in his responsible work to strengthen and develop the union as well as good health.
